question: If two vehicles from different directions arrive at the same time at an intersection with no signs or signals, then

answers.text: the driver on the left must allow the driver on the right to go first
the driver on the right must allow the driver on the left to go first
the driver of a heavy vehicle must allow the smaller vehicle to go first
the driver turning right must allow the driver turning left to go first

question: When waiting to make a left turn, a driver must

answers.text: keep the front wheels pointed straight
keep the front wheels pointed toward the left
keep the front wheels toward the right

feedback: When waiting to make a left turn, always keep your front wheels pointed straight ahead until you start the turn. This prevents you from being pushed into oncoming traffic if another vehicle crashes into you from behind.

question: When you approach a school bus with flashing red lights and an extended stop sign, you must

answers.text: pass the bus quickly with an increased speed
stop and remain stopped until the bus moves again

feedback: You must stop for stopped school buses with flashing red lights and an extended stop sign when you approach from any direction on a public or private road. Stop and remain stopped until all children are clear and the bus moves again.

question: If you park next to a curb, you may not park__________from the curb.
feedback: If you park next to a curb, pull close to it. You may not park more than one foot from the curb.

question: The distance a vehicle travels between the time the driver recognizes a problem and the time he/she applies the brakes is known as
feedback: The distance your vehicle travels between the time you recognize a problem and the time you apply the brakes is known as the reaction distance. Reaction distance is part of the stopping distance.

question: When you leave your vehicle parked downhill parallel to the curb on the right side of the road, you must turn the front wheels
feedback: When you leave your vehicle parked downhill parallel to the curb on the right side of the road, you must turn front wheels toward the curb or toward the right to prevent the vehicle from rolling into the street.

question: If two vehicles from different directions arrive at the same time at an intersection with no signs or signals, then

answers.text: the dirver turning right must allow the driver turning left to go first
the driver of a heavy vehicle must allow the smaller vehicle to go first
the driver on the right must allow the driver on the left to go first
the driver on the left must allow the driver on the right to go first

feedback: When two vehicles from different directions arrive at the same time at an intersection with no signs or signals, the driver on the left must allow the driver on the right to go first.

question: A flashing yellow light means that you should

answers.text: speed up to clear the intersection
slow down and preceed with caution

feedback: A flashing yellow light means that you should slow down and proceed with caution. Flashing yellow lights are positioned at relatively hazardous locations.

question: You may turn left at a red light only when

answers.text: turning from a one-way street onto a two-way street
turning from a two-way street onto a one-way street
turning from a two-way street onto another two-way street
turning from a one-way street onto another one-way street

feedback: You may turn left at a red light if you are on a one-way street and turning left onto another one-way street. Before turning, you must come to a complete stop.

question: What does a broken white line on the pavement indicate?

answers.text: The right edge of the road
The left edge of the road
Lanes of traffic moving in different directions
Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction

feedback: Broken white lines separate lanes of traffic going in the same direction. You may change lanes with caution.

question: When following other vehicles, you must use __________ within 200 feet of the vehicle ahead.
feedback: Switch to low-beams whenever you meet the oncoming traffic to avoid blinding the other driver. When following, use low-beams whenever you are within 200 feet of the vehicle ahead.

question: If you are convicted of exceeding the speed limit in a highway work zone, you may be fined up to
'Blind spots' refer to?

answers.text: the areas in school zones where school children cross the road
the areas in the interstate where vehicles can be stopped for emergencies
the areas around  a vehicle that cannot be seen in the mirrors
the areas in residential roads where vehicles should not enter

feedback: Blind spots are danger areas that cannot be seen in the mirrors on either side of the vehicle. The best way to see a car in your blind spot is by quickly turning your head and glancing over your shoulder to ensure the way is clear before changing lanes or passing another vehicle.

question: The Virginia law requires that __________ must wear safety belts or restraints when the vehicle is in motion.

answers.text: the driver, rear seat passenger and children
the driver, front seat passenger and children

feedback: According to Virginia law, the driver and all front seat passengers must wear safety belts.A driver transporting anyone younger than age 18 must ensure that the passenger is properly secured in a safety belt,booster seat or child safety seat,no matter where the child is seated in the vehicle.

question: A double solid yellow line in the center of the road means that

answers.text: passing  is allowed in either direction
passing is not allowed in either direction
traffic can go in only one direction.
all traffic must stop at the line.

feedback: Double solid yellow lines mark the center of a road and separate traffic traveling in opposite directions. Passing is not allowed in either direction. Drivers may not cross the lines unless they are making a left turn.

question: If you drive at 55 mph on dry, level pavement, your average stopping distance will be
feedback: If you drive at 55 mph on a dry, level pavement, your average stopping distance will be 265 feet.The stopping distance increases in adverse conditions.

question: If your car stalls on the rail tracks and you see or hear a train coming, you should

answers.text: try to move your car from the tracks
turn on emergency signals to alert the train Drivers
get out of the car and move away from the tracks
use you hand signal to alert the  oncoming train

feedback: If your car stalls on the tracks and you see or hear a train coming,you should get out of the car right away and run diagonally away from the tracks in the direction of the oncoming train.

question: If an emergency vehicle using a siren and flashing lights approaches you,you must __________ until the emergency vehicle has passed.

answers.text: safely pull over to the left edge of the road and stop
safely pull over  to the right edge of the road and stop
stop in your lane of travel

feedback: When police, fire and rescue vehicles or ambulances approach you from behind your vehicle using a siren, flashing lights or both, you must immediately yield the right-of-way.Safely pull over to the right edge of the road and stop until the emergency vehicle has passed.

question: When driving under 35 mph on Virginia roads, you should maintain a space cushion between you and the vehicle ahead of you by using
feedback: When driving under 35 mph on Virginia roads, you should maintain a space cushion between you and the vehicle ahead of you by using the two - second following distance rule.You should count“ 1001,1002” to determine the appropriate following distance.

question: A pennant sign on a roadway is

answers.text: an indicator of unusual conditions near work zones
an advance warning of a no-passsing zone
an advance warning of a closed road head

feedback: This sign marks the beginning of a no-passing zone. You may not pass vehicles ahead of you in your lane, even if the way is clear.

question: What is the maximum permitted speed for passenger vehicles on Virginia interstate highways in certain rural areas, unless otherwise posted?
feedback: A speed limit is the maximum legal speed you can travel on a road under ideal conditions. The maximum speed allowed for passenger vehicles on Virginia interstate highways in certain rural areas is 70 mph.

question: If a driver puts his left arm down at a right angle, he is doing to:
How can you tell when it is safe to return to the right lane after passing a vehicle on the left?

answers.text: When you can see the other driver in your mirror.
When you can no longer see the other car next to you.
When you feel as though you have passed the other car.
When you can see the headlights of ther other car in your rearview mirror.

question: In which of the following situations do you have the right of way?

answers.text: When you are leaving a parking spot.
When you are leaving a traffic circle.
When you are merging onto the highway.
when you are in a traffic circle.

question: You approach an intersection that is blocked by other vehicles. What do you do?

answers.text: Push on the horn to make the other cars move.
Go as far forward as possible.
Wait outside the intersection until you can get through fully.

question: Which of the following is NOT a determinant of your Blood Alochol content?

answers.text: How long you wainted after drinking.

When you are driving on snow, you must brake:
True or False: A truck's blind spot can reach up to 20 feet in front of a cab and almost 200 feet in the rear.

Wjem driving into a multi-lane rotary, drivers must:

answers.text: Choose their lane and maintain it until exiting.
Do not attempt to overtake and pass a vehicle in the lane over if not exiting immediately.

question: Which applies to Braking Distance?

answers.text: The time takes you to recognize a hazards.
The distance your car travels after you apply the brakes.
The distance your vehicle travels between the time you recognize a problem and the time you apply the brakes.

question: The Virginia DMV advises you keep your hands on the steering wheel in a(n):

The areas around your vehicle that you can see.
The areas around your vehicle where the view is obstructed.
Parts of the road that are shadowed and cannot be viewed clearly.

question: You are planning on turning right at the next intersection. You should use your blinker:

Which of the following must you obey over the others

answers.text: If you need to unload passengers.
If you need to load passengers.
If you are going to be back in your within one minute.

question: If you need to change lanes, the best way to do it is:

answers.text: In a manner you feel is best.

question: A school bus has its stop sign out and its lights flashing. You are on the opposite side of the one-lane street. You:

answers.text: Stop completely, and then pass as long as no children are crossing.
Slow down and stay vigilant of crossing children, but since you are on the opposite side of the street, you do not need to stop.
Stop and wait for the bus to lower its sign before continuing on.
